summary: usain bolt will compete at the iaaf/btc world relays in the bahamas next month , the jamaica athletics administrative association has announced . the six-time olympic gold medallist will compete at the relay championship on may 2 and 3 as part of the jamaican team . ` i 'm happy to be part of the jamaican team for the iaaf / btc world relays in the bahamas .

aspect: 1. Usain Bolt will compete at the IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas next month.
2. Jamaica Athletics Administrative Association has announced Bolt's participation.
3. Bolt will run as part of the Jamaican team on May 2 and 3.
4. Bolt is fit and ready to run.
5. Bolt is excited to participate in the World Relays in the Bahamas.
6. Bolt wants to make Jamaica proud while wearing the national colors.
explain: The aspect states that Usain Bolt will compete in the upcoming IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas next month as part of the Jamaican team. This announcement from the Jamaica Athletics Administrative Association indicates that the six-time Olympic gold medalist is ready to get back into competitive action after his retirement.

According to the aspect, Bolt's participation at the iaaf/btc world relays in the bahamas next month has been announced by the Jamaica Athletics Administrative Association. This means that he will be competing at the championship as part of the Jamaican team.

Usain Bolt, a six-time Olympic gold medallist, will run as part of the Jamaican team in the iaaf/btc world relays in the Bahamas on May 2 and 3. The core idea of this aspect is that Bolt will be competing in the relay championship alongside his teammates as part of the Jamaican team.

Usain Bolt is in good physical condition and ready to participate in the upcoming IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas next month as part of the Jamaican team, according to his team association official announcement. This means that he has recovered completely from any previous injuries or issues and is ready to prove his fitness on the track.

The aspect states that Usain Bolt is excited to participate in the World Relays in the Bahamas. This suggests that Bolt is looking forward to being a part of the prestigious event and representing his country, Jamaica. It indicates his enthusiasm and eagerness to compete with other top athletes from around the world.

Usain Bolt's desire to make Jamaica proud while representing the national colors highlights the importance of wearing the colors of one's country in international competitions. Bolt recognizes that his actions while wearing the Jamaican colors will reflect on the entire country, and he is determined to make them proud. This aspect demonstrates Bolt's deep sense of national pride and his commitment to representing his country to the best of his abilities.
